intro: Noccaea auerswaldii, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and cruciform petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in harsh, high-altitude environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in cold climates. Noccaea auerswaldii is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
